newsitem.title: KENYA: Nairobi bourse index falls in moderate trading.
newsitem.headline: Nairobi bourse index falls in moderate trading.

text.p: The Nairobi bourse 20-share index fell on Monday, dragged down by falling prices in most leading counters due to a supply in excess of demand, dealers said.

The Nairobi Stock Exchange 20-share index was down 14.94 points to stand at 3020.38. Turnover was posted at 8.343 million shillings on 236,334 shares compared to 7.538 million shillings on 220,919 shares on Friday.
A bourse official described Monday's trading as moderate. "There were no big lots dealt from the special board, just the usual many small deals."
A broker said following increased rates on government treasury bills, investors had diverted their funds from the secondary market to treasury bills.
But the broker added that there was also reduced interest from investors because most companies had already announced their results and there appeared nothing sigificant to stir the market.

As a primary issue of Kenya Commercial Bank closes on Tuesday, a floor dealer described purchases of the bank's shares as "furious", with institutional investors worried they might not get their full allotments.
Brokers said the continued demand was boosted by 's announcement of its interim results.
Kenya Commercial Bank traded 35,245 shares at a steady 58 from 59, Standard Chartered Bank fell to 45.25 from 45.75 while Barclays Bank eased to 98 from 98.50.
Among plantations, Brooke Bond fell 2.0 shillings to 177, Rea Vipingo eased to 10.75 from 10.95. An official said that foreign investors dealt 9,000 shares of Sasini Tea & Coffee at 52.50 from 50.
Kenya Airways traded 56,7545 shares at 9.70 from 9.85, Uchumi Supermarket eased to 46.50 from 57.50.
Oil concern Total Kenya fell to 70 from 71.50.
